pullRequest.body:
Replace the `IsLocalRingHom` with `IsLocalHom`. Add instances for `IsLocalHom` in `CommRingCat` to resolve the problem caused by #6045. For a more detailed explanation of the problem, see https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17403#issuecomment-2418322525. Further golf some proof related to `IsLocalHom` instance search.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [x] depends on #6045 

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by faenuccio.
Please add deprecated aliases.

According to [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Alias.20of.20Prop.20type.20instances/near/476166848), currently, there is a bug when creating aliases for instances. Thanks to @eric-wieser, we can replace `instance` with `@[instance] theorem` to solve this problem.
Can you keep `IsLocalRingHom` as an alias that only accepts `R ->+* S` (and not arbitrary funlike)? I strongly suspect this will solve the instance troubles.

> Can you keep `IsLocalRingHom` as an alias that only accepts `R ->+* S` (and not arbitrary funlike)? I strongly suspect this will solve the instance troubles.

@erdOne I agree with you that a class that only accepts `R ->+* S` will solve the problem and I am very happy to fix it myself. I just want to make sure I understand your proposed solution correctly. Following your suggestion, `IsLocalRingHom` and `IsLocalHom` would be different classes with an instance linking them. 
```
instance isLocalHom_IsLocalRingHom (f : R ->+* S) [IsLocalRingHom f] : IsLocalHom f := sorry
```
Should I 
1. use as much `IsLocalRingHom` as possible in the conclusions and as much `IsLocalHom` as possible in the conditions, or
2. establish a separating point in the file tree, such that instances defined after a certain point (e.g., the file Algebra.Category.Ring.Instances) only use `IsLocalRingHom`.

Maybe we should continue on zulip if more discussion is needed.
I mean `abbrev IsLocalRingHom (f : R ->+*S) : Prop := IsLocalHom f` which should work well with the typeclass system.

> I mean `abbrev IsLocalRingHom (f : R ->+*S) : Prop := IsLocalHom f` which should work well with the typeclass system.

Thank you! I'll try it.

@erdOne I've tried to implemented your suggestion in [bad175b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17403/commits/bad175b604a15da4c8cd51ef5c6d42e0163b4099).

The main obstacle is that Lean cannot infer `IsLocalHom f` from `IsLocalRingHom f` when `f` is a complex construction in category theory. The following example (from the file `Algebra.Category.Ring.Instances` in [bad175b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17403/commits/bad175b604a15da4c8cd51ef5c6d42e0163b4099)) reflects part of the problem. 
```
import Mathlib.Algebra.Category.Ring.Basic
import Mathlib.RingTheory.Localization.Away.Basic
import Mathlib.RingTheory.LocalRing.RingHom.Basic

instance CommRingCat.isLocalHom_ofIsLocalRingHom {R S : CommRingCat} (f : R âŸ¶ S)
    [IsLocalRingHom f] : IsLocalHom f :=
  inferInstance

@[instance]
theorem CommRingCat.isLocalRingHom_comp {R S T : CommRingCat} (f : R âŸ¶ S) (g : S âŸ¶ T)
    [IsLocalHom g] [IsLocalHom f] : IsLocalRingHom (f â‰« g) :=
  RingHom.isLocalRingHom_comp _ _

variable {R S T : CommRingCat} (f : R âŸ¶ S) (g : S âŸ¶ T)
    [IsLocalHom g] [IsLocalHom f]
#synth IsLocalRingHom (f â‰« g) -- succeed
#synth IsLocalHom (f â‰« g) -- succeed
```
Removing `CommRingCat.isLocalHom_ofIsLocalRingHom` will cause `#synth IsLocalHom (f â‰« g)` to fail. Changing `CommRingCat.isLocalRingHom_comp` to `CommRingCat.isLocalHom_comp` will cause `#synth IsLocalRingHom (f â‰« g)` to fail.



This `CommRingCat.isLocalHom_ofIsLocalRingHom` only solves a small part of the problems. Similar problems remain in many places, e.g. 
1. in the file `Mathlib.Geometry.RingedSpace.LocallyRingedSpace`, Lean cannot infer `IsLocalHom (f.val.stalkMap x)` from `IsLocalRingHom (f.val.stalkMap x)`.
2. in the file `AlgebraGeometry.Spec`, Lean cannot infer `IsLocalHom (stalkIso (â†‘S) p).inv`, but `IsLocalRingHom (stalkIso (â†‘S) p).inv` can be inferred. I've also checked that the following example works in this file
```
variable {R S : CommRingCat} (f : R â‰… S)
#synth IsLocalHom f.inv --succeed
```
But `IsLocalHom (stalkIso (â†‘S) p).inv` still fails.
Shall we open a discussion for this on Zulip?

Update: With the help of @chrisflav , I'm trying to reimplement the suggestion again, change back all `IsLocalHom` to `IsLocalRingHom` in the folder `AlgebraicGeometry` `Geometry` and add this one instance
```
instance CommRingCat.isLocalHom_ofIsLocalRingHom {R S : CommRingCat} (f : R âŸ¶ S)
    [IsLocalRingHom f] : IsLocalHom f :=
  inferInstance
```
Update: @erdOne This PR is ready for review again.

All of the following solutions will create unexpected troubles in the proof inside the definition `AlgebraicGeometry.Spec.locallyRingedSpaceMap` in the file `AlgebraicGeometry.Spec`.

1. define `abbrev IsLocalRingHom (f : R ->+*S)` for ring `R` and `S` and add instance `CommRingCat.isLocalHom_ofIsLocalRingHom`
2. define `abbrev IsLocalRingHom (f : R âŸ¶ S)` for morphisms in the `CommRingCat` and add instance `CommRingCat.isLocalHom_ofIsLocalRingHom`
3. define a new class `IsLocalRingHom (f : R ->+*S)` for ring `R` and `S` and add suitable instances
4. define a new class `IsLocalRingHom (f : R âŸ¶ S)` for morphisms in the `CommRingCat` and add suitable instances

The new troubles in `AlgebraicGeometry.Spec.locallyRingedSpaceMap` are similar to the previous ones caused in #6045 . Thanks to @chrisflav , we figured out what the problem is. Here is a mwe of the problem:
```
def Bar (R : Type) : Type := R

class Foo {R : Type} (f : R â†’ R) : Prop where
  foo {a : R} (h : f a = f a) : True

instance (R : Type) : Coe (Bar R â†’ R) (R â†’ R) where
  coe f := f

def baz (R : Type) : Bar R â†’ R := id

instance boo (R : Type) : Foo (baz R) where
  foo _ := trivial

example (R : Type) (a : Bar R) (ha : baz R a = baz R a) : True :=
  /- it fails after commenting the next line out -/
  haveI : Foo (baz R) := inferInstance
  Foo.foo ha
```
The type of the implicit argument `R` in the last line's `Foo.foo` is inferred as `R` by Lean. However, in `instance boo` the type of the implicit argument `R` in `Foo.foo` is `Bar R`.

Similar things happen for `IsLocalHom`. The implicit arguments `R` and `S` in `IsLocalHom` will be deduced using `CommRingCat.instFunLike'` instead of `CommRingCat.instFunLike` when one starts with a morphism of the form `f : CommRingCat.of R âŸ¶ S`. This causes the troubles we encounter in #6045 and here.

So we chose to solve the problem by adding three directly related instances to the file `Algebra.Category.Ring.Instances`. Now all manually assigned instances in #6045 are removed successfully. I also golfed some pre-existing manually-assigned-instances prooflines.

Thanks a lot for all of this!
Could you update the PR commit message?
Does the remaining `IsLocalHom f` where `f` is an arrow in `CommRingCat` not cause any problems?

> Thanks a lot for all of this! Could you update the PR commit message?

Fixed.

> Does the remaining `IsLocalHom f` where `f` is an arrow in `CommRingCat` not cause any problems? 

No new problems were discovered after I implemented the current solution.

Okay great!

ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

Thanks :tada:

```suggestion
-- These three instances solve the issue where the `FunLike` instances provided by
-- `CommRingCat.instFunLike'`, `CommRingCat.instFunLike''`, and `CommRingCat.instFunLike'''`
-- are not syntactically equal to `CommRingCat.instFunLike` when applied to
-- objects of the form `CommRingCat.of R`.
-- To prevent infinite loops, the priority of these three instances must be set lower
-- than that of other instances.
```
Also can you use block comment syntax `/- ... -/` instead?
Fixed. Thanks.

```suggestion
  f.prop x
```

```suggestion
variable {X Y : Scheme.{u}} (f : X âŸ¶ Y)
```

nodes.body:
@erdOne I've tried to implemented your suggestion in [bad175b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17403/commits/bad175b604a15da4c8cd51ef5c6d42e0163b4099).

The main obstacle is that Lean cannot infer `IsLocalHom f` from `IsLocalRingHom f` when `f` is a complex construction in category theory. The following example (from the file `Algebra.Category.Ring.Instances` in [bad175b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17403/commits/bad175b604a15da4c8cd51ef5c6d42e0163b4099)) reflects part of the problem. 
```
import Mathlib.Algebra.Category.Ring.Basic
import Mathlib.RingTheory.Localization.Away.Basic
import Mathlib.RingTheory.LocalRing.RingHom.Basic

instance CommRingCat.isLocalHom_ofIsLocalRingHom {R S : CommRingCat} (f : R âŸ¶ S)
    [IsLocalRingHom f] : IsLocalHom f :=
  inferInstance

@[instance]
theorem CommRingCat.isLocalRingHom_comp {R S T : CommRingCat} (f : R âŸ¶ S) (g : S âŸ¶ T)
    [IsLocalHom g] [IsLocalHom f] : IsLocalRingHom (f â‰« g) :=
  RingHom.isLocalRingHom_comp _ _

variable {R S T : CommRingCat} (f : R âŸ¶ S) (g : S âŸ¶ T)
    [IsLocalHom g] [IsLocalHom f]
#synth IsLocalRingHom (f â‰« g) -- succeed
#synth IsLocalHom (f â‰« g) -- succeed
```
Removing `CommRingCat.isLocalHom_ofIsLocalRingHom` will cause `#synth IsLocalHom (f â‰« g)` to fail. Changing `CommRingCat.isLocalRingHom_comp` to `CommRingCat.isLocalHom_comp` will cause `#synth IsLocalRingHom (f â‰« g)` to fail.



This `CommRingCat.isLocalHom_ofIsLocalRingHom` only solves a small part of the problems. Similar problems remain in many places, e.g. 
1. in the file `Mathlib.Geometry.RingedSpace.LocallyRingedSpace`, Lean cannot infer `IsLocalHom (f.val.stalkMap x)` from `IsLocalRingHom (f.val.stalkMap x)`.
2. in the file `AlgebraGeometry.Spec`, Lean cannot infer `IsLocalHom (stalkIso (â†‘S) p).inv`, but `IsLocalRingHom (stalkIso (â†‘S) p).inv` can be inferred. I've also checked that the following example works in this file
```
variable {R S : CommRingCat} (f : R â‰… S)
#synth IsLocalHom f.inv --succeed
```
But `IsLocalHom (stalkIso (â†‘S) p).inv` still fails.
Shall we open a discussion for this on Zulip?

Update: With the help of @chrisflav , I'm trying to reimplement the suggestion again, change back all `IsLocalHom` to `IsLocalRingHom` in the folder `AlgebraicGeometry` `Geometry` and add this one instance
```
instance CommRingCat.isLocalHom_ofIsLocalRingHom {R S : CommRingCat} (f : R âŸ¶ S)
    [IsLocalRingHom f] : IsLocalHom f :=
  inferInstance
```
Update: @erdOne This PR is ready for review again.

All of the following solutions will create unexpected troubles in the proof inside the definition `AlgebraicGeometry.Spec.locallyRingedSpaceMap` in the file `AlgebraicGeometry.Spec`.

1. define `abbrev IsLocalRingHom (f : R ->+*S)` for ring `R` and `S` and add instance `CommRingCat.isLocalHom_ofIsLocalRingHom`
2. define `abbrev IsLocalRingHom (f : R âŸ¶ S)` for morphisms in the `CommRingCat` and add instance `CommRingCat.isLocalHom_ofIsLocalRingHom`
3. define a new class `IsLocalRingHom (f : R ->+*S)` for ring `R` and `S` and add suitable instances
4. define a new class `IsLocalRingHom (f : R âŸ¶ S)` for morphisms in the `CommRingCat` and add suitable instances

The new troubles in `AlgebraicGeometry.Spec.locallyRingedSpaceMap` are similar to the previous ones caused in #6045 . Thanks to @chrisflav , we figured out what the problem is. Here is a mwe of the problem:
```
def Bar (R : Type) : Type := R

class Foo {R : Type} (f : R â†’ R) : Prop where
  foo {a : R} (h : f a = f a) : True

instance (R : Type) : Coe (Bar R â†’ R) (R â†’ R) where
  coe f := f

def baz (R : Type) : Bar R â†’ R := id

instance boo (R : Type) : Foo (baz R) where
  foo _ := trivial

example (R : Type) (a : Bar R) (ha : baz R a = baz R a) : True :=
  /- it fails after commenting the next line out -/
  haveI : Foo (baz R) := inferInstance
  Foo.foo ha
```
The type of the implicit argument `R` in the last line's `Foo.foo` is inferred as `R` by Lean. However, in `instance boo` the type of the implicit argument `R` in `Foo.foo` is `Bar R`.

Similar things happen for `IsLocalHom`. The implicit arguments `R` and `S` in `IsLocalHom` will be deduced using `CommRingCat.instFunLike'` instead of `CommRingCat.instFunLike` when one starts with a morphism of the form `f : CommRingCat.of R âŸ¶ S`. This causes the troubles we encounter in #6045 and here.

So we chose to solve the problem by adding three directly related instances to the file `Algebra.Category.Ring.Instances`. Now all manually assigned instances in #6045 are removed successfully. I also golfed some pre-existing manually-assigned-instances prooflines.

Thanks a lot for all of this!
Could you update the PR commit message?
Does the remaining `IsLocalHom f` where `f` is an arrow in `CommRingCat` not cause any problems?

No new problems were discovered after I implemented the current solution.
